text: 0.33 l bottle from Bierhandwerk, best before February 2018. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, foamy, stable, white head. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity aroma of mainly banana, vanilla and clove. Quite sweet, malty, rather yeasty-spicy taste of banana, vanilla, clove and shy notes of citrus and coriander, followed by a short, slightly bitter, rather yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, rather effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Tasty, pleasant and saturating beer, but overall I would probably prefer any decent unfiltered Weizenbock. Doesnt feel like 7.5 % at all btw.

Bottle from Brewers Haven. Clear, bright golden pour with small, tight, white head. Grassy, grainy aroma, small hints of the banana notes from the style. Taste also adds some fruitiness, melon to the nice grain base. More banana at the finish. Not your traditional weizen.
0,33l fles gedeeld met ralf, goudgeel met een witte kraag. fantastisch goed mooie citroen en kruidnagel mooi helder om in de smaak

Bottle: Clear golden, loose n lacy white head, mineralic and wheaty nose, nevertheless some yeasty traces detectable; moderate bitter-sweet flavour with a slight acidity, medium bodied, but slim MF; lingering wheaty-fruity and herbal-citrussy finish. A fine example of an odd style...

Bottle from Biergreissler: Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is quite fruity with mainly banana, also some colves. Flavor is wheat, quit alcoholic, banana, intensive colves notes. Ends sharp alcolic. Alcohol is too present with a bit sharp notes so most of the nice fruitiness is covered.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear golden, medium white head. Bredy and wheaty malt, clove and smoke phenols with a hint of bananas. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, low to medium bitterness.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear yellow with a frothy, white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, dough, banana and bubblegum. Solid weizen altogether but a bit amplified. Very clean and crisp wheat flavor. On the sweeter side.

Közepes, nagyon tartós hab, gyönyörű borostyán szín. Illata gabonás, búzás, kissé banános. Kissé édeskés, búzás, malátás ízvilág, enyhe banános és citrusos aromákkal. Közepesen testes, erősen szénsavas, az enyhénél kissé erősebb keserűvel. Nagyon finom, de lehetne egy picit könnyedebb..
Pale yllow pour, almost 3 fingers of pure white foam. Nose is grain and a little yeast. Middle is honey sweet wheat, hint of banana, a sneak peak at the alcohol. Finish is ripe banana on soft malt.

Bottle. Light golden, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty - some wheat and sweetish aroma, light caramel/toffee and some fruitiness with light - some banana, faint hoppyness and alcohol. Body is medium, malty -some wheat and sweetish flavor with light - some caramel/ light toffee, light - some fruitiness, light - some banana, faint hoppyness and alcohol. Finish is short to average, lightly sweetish - sweetish, light caramel, light - some fruitiness, light banana with faint hoppyness and alcohol. Your typical weizenbock - nothing special/nothing wrong.
Clear golden, high carbonation, full head quickly disappearing. Grassy and sour mash aroma. Taste of banana and rubber.

Gulbrun klar med høyt hvitt skum. Noe røyklukt, trevirke, sitrus og krydder. Middels fylde. Pepperig, nellik, røkt, lett sødme mot banan, sirup og karamell, lett sitrus, korn og noe gjær. Middels lang.
Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a weizen glass. Aroma is clove, medium/light body, mediu/well carbonated, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is clove and some banana.

A dry hopped wheat Bock? Unusual to say the least!Into a Weihenstephaner tulip at just on cool. Looks pretty lacklustre. Straw gold and bright as bright with a single stream of bubbles lifting up a wash of short-lived white foam. Medicinal, phenolic nose hinting at cloves, plasticine, band-aids, wheat flour - really hard to pick-up and process. On the palate it is light, effervescent and kinked by a spicy alcohol warmth to the swallow. Banana comes through as does lemon curd, green apple, cloves and vanilla icecream. There is a mild bitterness to it but the soft, creamy finish and alcohol oddly lowers its intensity. The use of Crystal, Opal, Emerald, Sapphire and, a favourite of mine, Hallertauer Perle fall short of having much impact. Wheat prominent mid-palate has licks of strawberry bubblegum and tangelo to break it up. Aside the warmth it is highly approachable but just doesntt deliver whatever it was it actually wanted to deliver. I like my Wheat Bocks traditional, and am yet to be wooed by a White IPA. This is actually my least favoured of this great brewers releases. Will cellar one to see how it goes. (33cL, BB 08/02/18, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Pale golden color with a taller, stable off-white head. Steady flow of bubbles. Pure weizen scents with pale malt and wheat, light cloves, banana, and just a hint of mint. Fuller feel. Sweet start with a spicy middle. More spice than malt. Cloves dominate. Tasty weizenbock.

Bottle poured a clear yellow with a lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, banana, bubblegum and light clove. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, clove and light banana with a smooth dry lingering clove finish.
Bottle from Finger Lakes Beverage center. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Lots of banana and clove on the nose and tongue. Finished pretty clean. Nice!

(bottle, 33cl) Clear, golden colour with a blond and firm mid-sized foamy head. Pronounced wheat-malty aroma with notes of banana, white bread and mildly clovy spice. Moderately sweet and delicately sour flavour, medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Wheaty malt flavours upfront, giving a tinge of sourness, combined with present notes of banana and a mildly level of clovy spice; moderately sweet and delicately sour-tart finish with a well-covered alcoholic strength. Nice one. 18.VI.17
Light opaque yellow, white foam head. Does not appear a weizen in aroma and taste. Light hoppy aroma with fruit tones. Similar light bitter with soft fruit notes. ?? (Velp 201705)

Ar: Fruity banana, very pure and bright; some pineapple and tart peach; chalk and slightly sweet cracker malt; all very rounded and inviting. Ap: Crystal-clear golden, with cascading bubbles; medium white head with moderate-good retention, leaving a whipped-egg-like cap of foam, fairly thin, and a screen of bubbles along the glass sides. T: Banana and clean malt, very fresh and doughy; medium-low sweetness, mingling with black pepper and clove; underripe peach and plum; very clean alcohol warmth, with a touch of sweetness of its own; low bitterness, with no noticeable hop flavor; thick, fresh banana, pineapple, and clove on the finish. P: Medium body with high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: An absolute pleasure and a real "wow" beer; the banana, peach, clove, black pepper, and doughy malt flavors are all prominent yet balanced, fresh, and bright; smooth and creamy, with just enough alcohol warmth to give the beer some oomph!

Bottle:
Crystal clear gold with a tall white head.
Aroma is yeasty, light banana, wheat.
Taste is soft and sweet banana, wheat malt.
Drinks amazingly lightly for the ABV.
Just a bit of straw-like bitter.
Creamy......Excellent.
Bottle from SB. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Lemon, banana, coriander, wheat.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Banana, fruit, wheat.
Body: Medium to full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Banana, wheat, malt, fruit.

Bottle. Orange with a large, dense, white head. 3+ Aroma of bread, lemon, cloves, coriander, lawn. 7- Medium bodied, medium high carbonation. A fat malt presence that sweet and not very interesting mingled with mainly citrus and spices. Some banana but comes across mostly as vanilla. Wheat is a little tangy at the end (having not really shown up til then) and theres a welcome bit more bitterness than you might expect. Not really my sort of thing.

Bottle. Banana, orange, clove, wheat malt, alcohol, and straw aroma. Clear golden yellow with giant white head. Moderately sweet banana, orange, wheat malt, and moderately bitter alcohol/hay flavor. Good body. A bit boozy but overall great (and actually pretty fresh).

Clear golden color. Medium+ carbonation. Yeasty aroma, some bready notes, touch of bubblegum. Very smooth flavor. Quite sweet, but with a nice non-bitter hoppiness. Some clove comes through in the end. Has obvious fruity banana esters. Really pleasant and drinkable.
Light yellow color with small white head. Aroma and flavor are good, spicy yeasts with faint sweetness and breadyness. Its like a ighter, easier to drink weizenbock Pretty good overall
Kristallweizen är ingen favorittyp, men denna öl går mer åt hefeweizen i doft och smak. Gyllengul öl med ett vitt skum. Fruktighet, blommighet, örtig kryddighet och övermogna bananer i doft och smak.

Beautiful gold color with a fine mountainous head. Disappointing aroma - some definite vegetal notes. Flavor is first malty, then wheat comes through with a long spicy, clove finish. Other than the vegetal issue, this is quite an enjoyable weizenbock.

Bottled. 15cl sample. The aroma has strong cloves, bit grass, some toasted malt tones. Clear, golden coloured beer with a medium, white head. The taste is light bitter, light sweet, very spicy again, with hint of grass and a little banana. Easy drinking beer considering its abv. Pretty good.
Banana and skunk, dough nose. Clear amber, thick lacy head. Bready malt, banana hints, chewed gum. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Bottled, golden yellow color with big tall foam, solid aroma of bananas and spice, balanced flavor of clove and a Banana with a touch of metal from travel

330ml bottle. Appearance: Absolutely crystal clear light golden with a frothy white head and nice lacing. Beautiful. 
Aroma: True Weihenstephaner yeast, heavy bubble gum with some spicy clove. Fruity banana. 
Taste: Rich, intense malt sweetness reminiscent of a maibock, revealing underlying banana esters and spicy clove phenols. Minimal bitterness. 
Mouthfeel: Fairly heavy bodied, with a low to moderate carbonation, and a touch of alcohol heat on the swallow. 
Finish: Rich, bready, light caramel malt sweetness sticks around, with a retronasal banana aroma. 
Overall: World class beer. Beautiful appearance, amazing weihenstephaner yeast aroma, and a complex flavor that balances the rich bock maltiness against the yeast

33cl bottle. Pours a nice clear gold, fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet banana and clove, wheat, classic. Falvor is similiar, a bit sweetish. It would be nice to have their regular kristalweizen in 6 packs fresh (ish).
Golden color, white head with medium duration. Aroma with notes of citrus and some coriander. Flavor is slightly sweet, some citrus and spicy notes. Mild bitterness with fruity final.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Gall&Gall Culemborg.
Chrystal clear light golden with a thin white head. Yeasty bready aroma with some hops. Sweet taste with some banana. Slight boozy touch to it. Not my favorite Weihenstephaner due to that sweet alcohol hint but decent enough.
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 Tap @ WAMK Mannerheimintie. Crystall clear with white head. Banana, sweet malt. Very sweet with smooth malt, banana, anise, yeast. Very nice.

Bottle. Super clear gold color, big foamy ass white head with solid retention. Nose is banana, bubblegum, clove, yeasty spiciness. Mouth is crisp, light malt sweetness, and everything I just said was in the nose, plus some bready brioche crackery thing going on. Fucking ace, this. Prost!

Delicious bready aroma with distinct German yeastiness. Crystal clear pale yellow with a delightful foamy white head driven by extreme effervescence. More bready malt goodness in the taste with German yeast and a touch of vanilla. The body is very full and creamy given the light color. Noble hop bitterness balances the light honey/caramel sweetness perfectly. The alcohol is noticeable here (perhaps because it seems like a German lager which would be lower) but again expertly balanced. Finishes with a lasting malty taste and hop bitterness on the tongue. This is an excellent Weizenbock from an excellent German brewer. Prost!

330ml bottle. Clear golden with one finger white head. Aroma is sweet ripe bananas, light cloves, citrus, wheat and sweet fruitiness. Taste is dry wheat, yeast, banana, citrus, some alcohol and light dry peppery clove spiciness. Medium mouthfeel, light to medium carbonation and dry wheat aftertaste.

Grassy sweet Belgian yeast aroma. Clear bright gold body with a mild head that fades quick. Taste is of a crispy sweet bready Belgian-like yeast . Bubbly with a smooth mouthfeel in the finish. One of the best tasting beers I can remember. Light bodied and crisp.
Bottle from systembolaget. Just not too sure about these bocks. It comes across as a sweat-alochol strong mix which I dont personally find pleasant. Much prefer the original.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear golden colored brew with an nicely sweet bitter taste, subtle hints of banana. Weihenstephaner tries to jump on the Craftbeertrain i guess.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, vete, grön banan, korn, bubbelgum med örtiga och gräsiga toner. Stor sötma, fruktig, rund och len, fin beska.

Nice, balanced and clear combination of refreshing hoppy aromas and weizen nuances like wheat and banana. Almost too intense taste for medium/light body and medium carbonation. A bit hard combination to win with. Otherwise, good quality product.
Bottle at home. Malty. Sweet. Taste of boiled carrots, wine gums, white sour dough bread and some metallic citrus at the end.

Bottle. Clear golden with a big frothy white head that laces pretty heavily. Aroma of bubblegum, banana, clove, grain, and a hint of citrus soda. Medium-full bodied; surprisingly heavy. Smooth. Short finish. Tastes spiced yeasty and lightly sweet.

330ml bottle. Clear, golden colour with average to huge, creamy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Mellow, wheaty, fruity aroma, mild notes of banana, dried banana, banana leaf, hints of clove, a floral touch. Taste is minimally sweet wheaty, spicy, notes of dried banana, hints of clove, minimally leafy, hoppy overtones with a touch of white grapes (Gewürztraminer), lychee. Very clean, not too sweet, quite nice.

Bottle. Pours clear golden, large fluffy white head, dissipates slowly with lots of residual and clumpy lacing. Aroma is wheat, floral notes, clove, citrus, more clove. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, clove and floral hops. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Quite interesting actually. Hell, yes - Kristallweizen #9!

Poured from a 330 ml bottle. 
Aroma is very German with moderate banana, faint bubble gum, some moderate clove and hints of floral and spicy hops. Light wheat notes. As it warms and the esters blow off you pick up a bit more hop character. 
Pours a super clear, yellow gold with a large, thick, pillowy, white head that shows nice retention as the beer rises to recapture it. Moderately high lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor is fairly sweet with some lingering sweetness in the finish. Medium light wheat notes with hints of grain as well. Moderately strong banana esters with some faint bubble gum notes. Moderate clove notes. Medium low bitterness with some light floral hop notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with high carbonation. Low astringency and low, but present alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright beer but I really am not a huge fan of the big German esters and clove notes.

Tap at 3rd Ave Alehouse snuck out for lunch Fine clear golden pour. Nose is fruity wheat. Tastes of banana, candy sugar, wheat, orange blossom. Crisp and semi sweet finish. Style ticking at its finest.
Bottle. Golden blonde. Wheat, floral notes and grapes in the aroma. Wheaty sweetish flavor with orange and soft vinous notes. Floral. Tasty.
Tap at Hopaholic, Budapest. Clear golden shade. White head. Notes of honey and herbal elements popping up too. Slightly on the sweet side. Not bad.

Aroma: a little spice and apple juice; Appearance: clear golden pour with creamy white head that lingers; Taste: follows nose; a bit cloying; Palate: light bodied with long spicy finish; Overall: not my favorite style but can appreciate it.

On tsp at Hopaholic, Budapest. Pours pale yellow colour. Moderate white head. Sweetness, notes of banana, flowery notes, candy sugar in the aroma. Sweetness, caramel, candy sugar in the taste. Candy sugar and flowery notes in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, nicely balanced, classical brew. Bit sweet for me. But otherwise very solid one.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 clear golden colour, large, dense white head; aroma and taste of grainy-biscuity sweetness, slight banana notes and...well, practically nothing else, maybe some sugar...somehow more like a strong pale lager, than a weizedbock...it is a really crazy idea to make extra effort to screw up a weizen bock and produce this filtered beer

Bottle @ home. Pours a clear golden liquid with a huge white head that quite quickly dissipates.Aroma is sweet and dry with yeast, pepper, cloves, herbs, spicy hops,lemon, smoked ham and banana. Taste is sweet and medium bodied with a sweet but drier finish. Flavors of cloves, white pepper, wheat, honey, fudge, banana, lemon and herbs. FInish has banana, vanilla and spicy notes lingering.

Pours a clear pale gold with a tall eggshell head of foam that leaves intricate clumpy lacing. Nose involves weizen yeast, lemon, spice, clove, and sweet dough. Decently sweet, lightly bitter. Medium bodied, fairly oily, softer, syrupy, with a juicy fruit gum kind of finish. Decent, but too heavy (I know thats the point). And as always with this style, why filter it?

0,33 l bottle bought at Just in Beer, Groningen, 1,95 . Kristall Weizenbock, what an obscure style. Okay, clear golden in the glass, as expected, with an one finger white head. Mainly some banana and other fruits on the nose, little bit wheat, hints of hop. Taste starts smooth, some banana, sulfur, some alcohol in the background. Typical Hefeweizen taste, also some herbal elements and little bit more pale grainy. Balanced and easy to drink for its strength. One of the better Kristall Weizen.

helder gouden met volle witte kraag. aroma van veel mout, tarwe, banaan, zoet, zacht, citrus, hop, wat kruidnagel, goed en typische Weizen aroma.Smaken van wat zoete oude overrijpe bananen, zacht en glad, wat romig van textuur, mout, redelijk zoet, zwak bitter, citrus, wat zepig, gist, medium body, normale co2, afdronk wat citrus, zepig met lange aanhoudende bitterheid. ben er niet helemaal weg van.
Klar som vatten, mycket ljus gul, mycket lätt färgat skum. Doft: Skumbanan, godis persikor, röda äpplen, växter, APK-limpa. Smak: Som doft i stort fast sötare med betoning på godiset + vete.
Aroma is bananas, wheat and a hint of spices. The flavor is wheat, bananas slight fruit and a mix of mild spices/cloves and very light sour/dry in the finish.

The alcohol in this beer makes it much to strong to be a kristallweizen, and it is much more of a weizenbock. Initially a very tall white head and gold colored beer. Aroma of a hefeweizen, banana, some clove. Flavor is sweet, much more flavorful than kristallweizen would be, sweet wheat beer flavors and characteristic Weihenstephan yeast. Not quite as sweet as their hefeweizen, and more hop presence. Good.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Beautiful clear gold with lasting head and lace. Vanilla banana coconut pina colada aroma. Sweet with vanilla maltiness and then the perfect hit of grassy bitterness. Medium light body, bold natural sweetness, lively carbo, soft mouthfeel. Easily the best kristall Ive had. I dont even think I like any others.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 Flaska från SB. Kristalklar, gyllengul med vit skumkrona. Doft av skumbanan och vetemalt. Söt och halvtorr kropp. Smak av skumbanan, hö, honung, jäst och ljus knäck.

Först och inte främst; den karaktäristiska bananjästaromen som finns i praktiskt taget all veteöl gör sig ganska dåligt i kombination med en lite stickig alkohol. Kom ihåg det nästa gång ni ska köpa tilltugg till fredagsgroggen...skippa bananerna, om de nu nånsin var aktuella. För det andra, och det främsta; utöver ovannämnda snedsteg är det här ett fantastiskt soffsällskap. Förvånansvärt mycket sötma och oväntat lite bäska. Dessutom otroligt vacker och krispig att titta på.

0.33l bottle. No surprise that its a clear one. It has a really big and good looking almost fluffy white head, loaded with lacings over a golden colored beer. It smells really nice and. A rush of banana yeast. Reminds me of sweet banana bugg. Slightly lemony almost. Lots of nice sweet aromas going on. Its just below average on the carbonation and its light oily in the mouth. Bready flavors. More banana, wheat sweetness. Strange but almost a little plastic artificial. Its quite tasty though. A genre that makes no sense. 21.04.2017

Bottled 330ml (Alko web)
Clear golden color, good white head. Aroma has overriped banana and some earthy hoppyness. Medium-bodied. Flavour has overriped banana (even a bit glueish feeling), alcohol and fruity hoppyness. Simple but with filtering lacks substance.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity smell with foam banana and ripe fruits. Similar taste. Boozy. Not my thing.

Bottle shared by Thomas W thanks. Big and lasting white head. Nice sparkle and clear pale yellow color. Amazing light yellow color. Big aroma of bananas and fruits. Mild malty sweetness and low bitterness.

(Weihenstephaner Kristallweizenbock) Tap at Cafe Samson, Nijmegen.
Golden yellow colour on the body, crystal clear, with a tall and thick white head on top, good retention.
Aroma of grass, wheat, earthy notes.
Taste has grass,straw, earthy notes.
Medium thin body, good carbonation.
Decent beer.

Weihenstephaner Kristallweizenbock
German Kristallweizen
646413

Lukt: Drops, frukter, ingefær, høy og hvete.
Utseende: Lys gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Drops, frukter og høy.
Hvor: Tasting kveld på Bryne.
Medium: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */,5%, Nå[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is slightly diacetylic with some fruity and floral notes as well as some wheat and mild toffee. Flavour is banana, clove, wheat and some slight toffeeish and mild herbal notes. Quite a nice one, which actually tastes more of a Hefeweizen than most other Kristallweizens Ive had. And the alcohol suits in with the flavour really nicely.
Bottle. Nose is huge malt richness. Light peppery hops. Modest phenolic. Less banana. Tatse follows with a light banana presence finally coming through. Pretty dang good.
SB beställning, flaska. Luktar Vitus men ändå inte. Fin bockton komplex och lite vassare än Vitus som blir referensen. Lite åt Chimay faktiskt. Humlemixen ? Saknar jästen....

Bottled from Systembolaget
Clear golden with a large, white head. 
Sweet weiss-aroma and flavour with banana and clove. 
Crisp and dry.
En ganska snäll upplevelse. Inte så veteig smak som förväntat. Döljer alkoholen enormt bra!

Bottle from web SB cons 2017-04-14 Göteborg
My 7th German Kristallweizen 
AR: wee sour dough, banan foam
AP: clear coppery bubbly flyid, stouty cream yellowish white steady lid
F: sweet banan foam, flour, dry sweet mouth feeling, wee hint of caramel, medium bitternees,

330ml brown bottle poured into a pint glass. Appearance is clear yellow with an abnormally large off-white head with long retention. Aroma of banana, lemon zest, herbs, bubblegum and dough. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, slightly sticky texture and medium carbonation. Weihenstephaner Kristallweizenbock is okay, nice aroma but sickeningly sweet, I had enough about halfway through the bottle.
330ml Bottle - Golden with a foamy white head. Banana, lemon and a hint of spice in the aroma. Fresh and fairly clean taste with banana and bubblegum standing out.

Pours clear yellow with low white head
Aromas of banana candy, phenols, bread, hints of hay, caramel, some sweet fruits
Taste has notes of banana, sweet candy, hay, bread, caramel, herbs
Mouthfeel is full bodied, average carbonation, sweet with low bitterness

Color dorado amarillento, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de cuatro dedos de grosor (muy buena retención). Carbonatación a tope. Textura acuosa. Aroma a trigo, pan, plátano, levadura, lúpulo y un toque floral. Sabor que contiene todo lo anterior, suave en boca, con dosis mínima de amargor final que redondea el conjunto. Muy rica, con el alcohol bien integrado y más compleja que muchas cervezas de trigo.
@ Havregatan 20170412. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Wheaty and yeasty, estery, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and wheaty with estery notes.
33cl bottle. clear golden color. medium white head. sweet banana, wheat. medium bitterness and carbonation.

Pours clear light golden with a massive frothy white head. Aromas of rye bread, citrus, minerals, bananas, esters. Taste is estery and floral with light fruitiness and mineral notes. Mouthfeel is crisp and light bodied with a significant amount of carbonation.
Pale golden color, huge white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, hay, honey and bread. Taste of wheat, alcohol, yeast, honey, hay and bread.
29-03-17 // draft at Hopaholic Budapest. Clear golden beer with big white head. Banana yeasty nose. Taste is slightly banana, some yeast. Light bitter hops. Very solid.
tap @ hopaholic (budapest) clear yellow colour, normal body, average carobonated, silky, yeast, bit citrus flavour, wheatbeer notes

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 330 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled on 2/8/2017. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 2-3 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with insane retention, that reduces to a large cap that lasts. Thick soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Insane appearance. Aromas of big banana, bubblegum, lemon, orange, clove, peppercorn, pear, apple, wheat, biscuit, light honey, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast, bready malt, and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big banana, bubblegum, lemon, orange, clove, peppercorn, pear, apple, wheat, biscuit, light honey, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate herbal bitterness and yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of banana, bubblegum, lemon, orange, clove, peppercorn, pear, apple, wheat, biscuit, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, bready malt, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance; and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Light dryness from bitter/spiciness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium-high carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, and lightly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol for 7.5%. Overall this is an incredible weizenbock! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, bready malt, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, easy, and pretty crisp/refreshing to drink. Even with the newer noble hop varieties used, this is nearly just as amazing as Vitus. A highly enjoyable offering.

Germany. Clear light yellow pour with a giant white head and very good retention. Decent lacing. Heavy clove nose. Soft mouthfeel. Banana, clove and yeast taste. Like a wit light. Not a fan of the style. 7.4 ABV is well hidden.

08.04.2017, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Huge foamy longlasting head, clear light straw colored. Aroma is mild fruity, yeast, banana, minerals, grass, flowers, fruit stones, paper, light malts, apple cores. Taste is slightly sour-ish mineraly, weeds, yeast, grass, minerals, banana, paper, bark, light malts, metal tank. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and metallic mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation. Fair enough.

330 ml bottle.

Clear golden with large white head and plenty of lacing. Sweet taste.

330 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden, medium sized whitehead, good lacing. Sweet and spicy aromas, banana, coriander, cloves and wheat bread. Full-bodied, silky mouthfeel, soft carbonated. Spicy and fruity taste, banana, cloves, peppery yeast, citrus, wheat bread and grains. Pleasant floral bitterness in the finish and a bit warming aswell.
Bottle. Clear golden with nice lastig foam. Aroma and taste is malt, wheat, banana, floral hops and bread. Taste is well balanced between malt and the rest. Nice.

330ml bottle. Pours a pale straw hue with a small white head. Aroma of spice, wheat and banana. Taste is spice, wheat, yeast, banana, clove, fruit. Finish has a lot of flavor, including various spices, banana and white pepper. Light to medium body. Good.
Bottle at home. Pours clear light golden with small white head. Aroma has funky fruits and wheat. Taste has ripe fruits, yeast and wheat. Pretty nice.

Bottled, 330 ml.
Clear yellow golden colour, bigger sized white head with average duration.
Gentle fruity, spicy nose.
Refined and clean aroma with banana, bubblegum and bread underpainted by mild citrusses, florals... mouthfeel is nicely slick.
Warming, mild spicy, citrus fruity finish.

33cl bottle shared at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Banana, wheat, sugar, bubble gum and some malts. The sweetness tasted a bit too artificial.

Tap (Poseidon, Helsinki)
Lovely clean banana-ey estery aroma, light and wheaty. Straw coloured, large tight persistent head. Full palate, pleasant carbonation. Delicious sweet wheatbeer taste, richly wheaty, gentle banana, a little spicing. Lovely and refreshing, and no sign of 7.5% at all. Lovely drink. So was the second glass. And the third.

Tallahassee, Fl - New Leaf Market - 330 ml bottle. Sparkling light golden pour, nice bubble action, tight snow white head. Aroma has some bubble gum and banana accents. Full bodied flavor, some light clove accents, a touch of yeast.bubble gum sweetness, just a touch of date-like fruitiness. Nice crisp mouthfeel.

Aroma is fruity, banana, caramel, clove, a bit too much banana for my liking. Appearance is golden, clear with lots of bubbles, off white head. Taste is banana, earthy hops, clove, slight caramel, a really interesting combination of flavors. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, caramel banana aftertaste. Overall, its weird but not off-putting.
Robe jaune pale mousse blanche épaisse. Nez céréales, Banane. Bouche banane, légèrement sucrée.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge. Clear
Golden color, good foam.
Medium aroma intensity; banana dominates, nice fruitiness, light honey and a
Nice
Malty backbone. Medium body & complexity. Some sweetness- balances very well. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a clear amber body with a medium white head. Nose is wheat, grains, banana esters and hints of red fruits and white sugar. Taste is wheat, red fruits, grains and hints of red fruits and caramel. Medium to full body, medium to high carbonation. Not very impressive, although it is a clean and well-balanced beer - it is just a bit boring.

33cl bottle.
This one sounded like a train wreck, a kristallweizen bock ?.
Appearance: anicentre good sized offwhite head on top of a clear golden. Head leaves some lacing.
Aromma:banana, wheat, minerals,bread
Taste: sweetish candy fruit, white bread,banana, a slight bitter finish, bread you, banana mineral aftertaste.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Overvall fully sticking to the name and delivering quite well.
Not the best beer they brewed, and not the best idea, but it does work.

On Tap. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 28/03/2017
Color dorado con una pequeña corona de espuma, aromas son dulces con notas a malta, el sabor es a levadura banana con toques a trigo y cereal, agradable de beber, buena cerveza.
On tap at hopaholic. Clear yellow colour, head disappears immediately. Nose is somewhat unpleasant. Taste is medium sweetness. Fast finish. No wheat taste at all.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours clear golden, big foamy white head. Aroma of sweet ripe banana, wheat and cloves. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Taste is sweet grainy, notes of pepper and herbs at the light dry finish. Sweet one

Bottle from Lekkerbier, Sint Nicolaasga. Aroma has lots of banana, wheat, sweet fruits, more ripe bananas with a floral touch and some notes of bubblegum. Flavour is sweet and lightly bitter. Body is medium. Clean and smooth, bit sweet and banana-heavy for my taste.
Clear as day. Bright golden colour. Aroma is bubblegum, flowers, and bananas. Taste is quite sweet, actually, with vanilla extract and sugary pastries.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2017 Caña en Cimmeria 25..03..2017 (r22). Color amarillento dorado transparente con espuma blanca. Sabores intensos a cereales con toques afrutados plátanos y ligeros herbaceos finales. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber. Refrescante suave pero no está nada mal. Bastante sabor para una de trigo.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 Sugary sweet aroma. Dry sweet minty kristallweisse taste but also has the boozy kick of a heller bock. Then it drops like an elevator with no brakes. No aftertaste. Dafaq? Worst Weihenstephaner Ive ever had. Pretty vacant, I?m actually a bit shocked. Pass on this one.

Keg @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 23-03-2017.
In short: clean weizen.
Pours very clean golden with frothy white head. Long head retention, good lacing. Wheat nose, typical, some banana, spicy clove. Medium body, average carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is sweet, cereal, some fruity, spicy. Seems like a filtered Vitus.

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Pours Nose is very bubblegumy, like overwhelmingly bubblegum, some citrus, banana. Palate is very hoppy, floral, bubblegum. Finish is short and hoppy. You dont notice the 7.5%, but a kristallweizenbock is just weird.

Enjoyed so much that had to rate even tough I sort of had retired after reaching 1500. Nice clear basic look, pure white head, clean. Tempting aroma. Cereal notes, nice fruity hops, bit herby notes, winey tones. Medium body, sweet, malty, lingering, peach, banana, wheat. Balanced, pure, minimal, has IT and that gets my points. I just enjoy this crafmanship.
Tap at Olhus Kopenhavn, Helsinki. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Some fruits, wheat, grain, some sweetness, some honey and malts. Pretty useless.
A very refreshing taste, with notes of herbs and banana. Brief but strong carbonation, just a touch of bitterness. A very pleasant beer to drink!
Pours a golden color with small creamy head. High Carbonation. Some notes of banana, vanilla and citrus detectable
Bottle at Red Hot. Pours clear golden, nose is banana, floral, pineapple, taste is sweet, banana, dry toffee, spiced.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2017 Découverte dans la Saveur Box. Bière blonde avec une belle mousse. Alcoolisée, on en penserai même que c?est une belge. Une touche fruitée. Bière de caractère. Belle découverte.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Draught @ Ølhus København. The beer poured golden color with a thin white head. Sweet fruity, peachy aroma, some banana. Flavor has sweetness, wheat, spices, banana. Long sweet finish.
Draught at WilliamK. Golden color, white head. Bitter with citrus, wheat, yeast, banana, hops and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, wheat, banana, yeast, grass and toast. Good weizenbock.

Draught. Clear golden in color with a whitish head. Wheat, sweet fruits and mashed ripe banana in aroma. Somewhat chewy wheaty mouthfeel. Sweet fruityness and hints of banana in taste. Easy drinking for a weizenbock and surprisingly tasty for being a kristall, but I still prefer the hefe versions.

Fruity nice estery nose. Juicy bitable peaches, yellow banana, light citrus. Med bldied light fluffy texture. Wheat malty flavour, good grainy malty, citrus estery. Really nkce flavourful, filling. Wouldve expected clearer yeasty esters from weihen tho.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Sampled at BKL2017. 
Banana aroma, light minerals.
Clear deep golden, white foam.
Medium full body, actually has the mouthfeel and flavor of a true weissbier. Heilerde and banana finish.

(Keg at Kittys, 20170226) The beer poured deep golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, banana and clove. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, grass, malts, banana and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet, spicy and bitter. A weizenbock without character.
Bottle. Golden body with white head. Aroma is yeast fruits sour. Taste is alcohol malty sweetness. Aftertaste is sweet and alcohol.
Sampled @ BKL 2017. Klare hell goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch bananig , Nelke. Geschmack sehr bananig, süß, wenig Nelke.
Trockener spritziger Beginn. Wenig aber erkennbar hefig, mittelstarke Würzigkeit. Dann herber werdend, sehr trocken bleibend. Nicht schlecht. 10/8/9/8/9/9
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is banana and yeasts. Taste is sour yeasts with some sweet banana notes. Medium drinkability. Some alcohohol in the finish. Ok.

From bottle at BKL München 2017.
Yellow-golden, clear body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, white head. 
Aroma with loads of banana, vanilla, some bread. 
Tastes quite similar, with some more sweet dried fruits. 
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. 
Finishes smooth, moderate sweet, a bit dry, with lots of banana again. 

Tasty. Surprisingly aromatic, considering its a filtered version. Loads of smooth, clean banana notes, that I like a lot. Drinks easier and crisper than a regular Weizenbock. Interesting experiment, that works very well in my opinion.

Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is straight candied bananas, without the other flavours usually coming from the yeasts. Taste is bananas, bananas, bananas, sweet bananas. Oily mouthfeel, surprisingly soft carbonation. I still dont see the point of Kristallweizen - although I have to admit this is pretty damn tasty.
